paragraphs.context: Extending your current valid visa or permit can be done through "Extend your application" under "Applications" from the global navigation menu. For extending a visa or permit applied using the Uganda Electronic Visa/Permit web site you should provide the application Id of the visa or permit to extend, the passport number used for the visa or permit to extend and the date of birth.

qas.question: How do I extend my visa or permit?

paragraphs.context: Replacing a permit can be done only if the permit was applied using the Uganda Electronic Visa/Permit web site. It can be done through "Replace your application" under "Applications" from the global navigation menu. For replacing a permit, it is mandatory to provide the application Id of the permit to replace, the passport number used for the permit to replace and the date of birth.

qas.question: How do I replace my permit?

paragraphs.context: If your application is rejected, you have 48 hours to leave the country however you are granted 30 days to either submit your application for review by the board or apply for appeal.

paragraphs.context:
The approval letter sent by email or downloaded through the Uganda Electronic Visa/Permit web site establishes that you are eligible for the approved visa or permit, but does not establish that your applicant is definitely approved.

This final approval will be done at the selected point of entry (in the case of a visa) or at the Immigration Office Headquarters where the visa or permit sticker will be printed and it will be pasted to the passport.
